newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Gazprom dominates quiet Russian share market.
newsitem.headline: Gazprom dominates quiet Russian share market.

text.p: Gazprom dominated an otherwise quiet Russian share market on Tuesday, rising strongly after announcing a price of $15.75 for its American Depositary Shares the previous day, dealers said.
Gazprom was one of the day's strongest gainers and the most active by turnover, with $5.85 million of shares changing hands on the Russian Trading System -- one third of total volume.
It closed at $0.505, off an early $0.530 high, after closing on Monday at $0.480. One ADS is equivalent to 10 shares.
A trader at Troika-Dialog said the Russian market was not much affected by the news as the domestic and international markets were separated.
According to Gazprom rules, foreigners cannot buy cheap Russian shares on the domestic market, while Russian operators cannot buy shares on the international market.
Gazprom bids rose to $0.500 on Tuesday, but there were many sellers at that level, dealers said.
But the shares could rise further.
"Out of all Russian shares Gazprom has the biggest potential from the point of view of its quotes growth, but when the rise will happen I cannot say," said the Troika trader.
